It seems that Bernard Madoff is not the only thief in town. Though small potatoes compared to Madoff, Stanford appears to be just as crooked.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 http://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/18/business/18stanford.html?_r=2&hp
 
 HOUSTON - The Securities and Exchange Commission accused Robert Allen Stanford, the chief of the Stanford Financial Group, on Tuesday of conducting "a massive ongoing fraud" in the sale of about $8 billion of high-yielding certificates of deposit held in the firm's bank in Antigua. Also named in the suit were two other executives and some affiliates of the financial group.

We get it, you hate democrats. Maybe someday you'll learn to judge people as people instead of assigning them arbitrary labels and deciding you don't like them based on that.

 I already have...and I don't hate Democrats. I voted for John Kennedy, among others. I would have voted for Joe Leiberman had he been nominated.
 
 What I hate is extreme liberalism and the idiocy that it brings to our government. I detest crooks no matter their party affiliation.
 
 I am in favor of what is good for our country...and liberalism/socialism/communism is not and never will be good for anything but the politicians and dictators that they produce.
 
 I quite frankly do not care what you think of me.
